options.text: The collision of galaxy clusters

options.label: D

options.label: D

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what is necessary for finding innovative solutions to difficult problems?

options.label: A
options.text: Focusing on a specific area of study

options.label: C

title: Why do we cry? The three types of tears - Alex Gendler

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the girl who is very sensitive and cries frequently?

options.label: A
options.text: Iris

options.label: B
options.text: Onion

options.label: C
options.text: Lily

options.label: D
options.text: Rose

multiple-choice.question: Describe the main function of the basal tears that Iris constantly produces.

options.label: A
options.text: To wash away harmful substances

options.label: B
options.text: To stabilize Iris's mood

options.label: C
options.text: To form a thin coating that keeps dirt and debris away

options.label: D
options.text: To signal Iris's emotional state to others

multiple-choice.question: If a person is exposed to a chemical irritant, such as the gas released by Onion's jacket, what type of tears will be released to help protect the eyes?

options.label: A
options.text: Basal tears

options.label: B
options.text: Reflex tears

options.label: C
options.text: Emotional tears

options.label: D
options.text: Lacrimal tears

multiple-choice.question: Analyze the composition of the three layers of the basal tears. Which layer is responsible for keeping the surface smooth for Iris to see through?

options.label: A
options.text: Mucus layer

options.label: B
options.text: Aqueous layer

options.label: C
options.text: Lipid layer

options.label: D
options.text: Lacrimal layer

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the chemical substance released by Onion's jacket that causes Iris to cry uncontrollably?

options.label: A
options.text: Syn-Propanethial S-oxide

options.label: B
options.text: Sulfenic acid

options.label: C
options.text: Sulfoxide

options.label: D
options.text: Lacrimal acid

multiple-choice.question: Design a solution to help Iris and Onion maintain their relationship despite Iris's sensitivity to Onion's jacket. What could they do to minimize the impact of the chemical reaction?

options.label: A
options.text: Onion could wear a different jacket

options.label: B
options.text: Iris could wear protective goggles

options.label: C
options.text: They could meet in a well-ventilated area

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above

multiple-choice.question: Evaluate the role of emotional tears in stabilizing Iris's mood. What is one possible explanation for their effectiveness?

options.label: A
options.text: They contain higher levels of stress hormones

options.label: B
options.text: They are a social mechanism to elicit sympathy

options.label: C
options.text: They are a natural pain killer

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above

multiple-choice.question: Compare and contrast basal tears, reflex tears, and emotional tears. Which type of tear is released in response to a loss of control or emotional state?

options.label: A
options.text: Basal tears

options.label: B
options.text: Reflex tears

options.label: C
options.text: Emotional tears

options.label: D
options.text: Lacrimal tears

multiple-choice.question: Synthesize the information about the three types of tears to explain how they work together to keep Iris balanced and healthy.

options.label: A
options.text: Basal tears provide a constant coating, reflex tears respond to irritants, and emotional tears stabilize mood

options.label: B
options.text: Basal tears respond to irritants, reflex tears provide a constant coating, and emotional tears signal emotional state

options.label: C
options.text: Basal tears stabilize mood, reflex tears signal emotional state, and emotional tears respond to irritants

options.label: D
options.text: Basal tears signal emotional state, reflex tears stabilize mood, and emotional tears provide a constant coating

multiple-choice.question: Justify the importance of the lacrimal glands and lacrimal puncta in maintaining Iris's eye health. What would happen if they were not functioning properly?

options.label: A
options.text: Iris would not be able to produce basal tears

options.label: B
options.text: Iris would not be able to drain old tears

options.label: C
options.text: Iris would be more susceptible to eye infections

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above
